Awake FILE v3.1

Awake FILE is a set of APIs for executing all sorts of operations on files between an Android device or a PC and a remote server through HTTP: file upload/download, access of remote files and directories, call of remote Java methods.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
org.kawanfw.commons.api.client
Provides class and interfaces to configure the Awake Commons parameters on the client side.
org.kawanfw.commons.api.server
Provides classes and interfaces to configure the Server side of KawanSoft Frameworks.
org.kawanfw.commons.api.server.util
Provides utility classes that may be used in Configurators.
org.kawanfw.file.api.client
Provides classes and interfaces for transferring files between a Client and a Server, accessing remote files and directories or to call remote Java methods through an HTTP session.
org.kawanfw.file.api.server
Provides classes and interfaces to configure the Awake Server for Awake FILE.
Awake FILE is a set of APIs for executing all sorts of operations on files between an Android device or a PC and a remote server through HTTP: file upload/download, access of remote files and directories, call of remote Java methods.

Awake FILE v3.0 includes now zero-learning APIs to access remote files, upload or download files:

  • The RemoteFile class has the same methods names and signatures as java.io.File: a RemoteFile method is a File method that is executed on the remote host.
  • The RemoteInputStream class implements InputStream and allows easy file download.
  • The RemoteOutputStream class implements OutputStream and allows easy file upload.
